Art Carneyâs Early Life

Art Carney was born on November 4, 1918, in Mount Vernon, New York. He was the youngest of six sons and showed an early interest in acting. His career began in radio, where he voiced numerous characters and honed his comedic skills.

Carneyâs breakthrough came with the television series âThe Honeymoonersâ, where he played the role of Ed Norton. His performance was highly acclaimed and earned him several awards, including five Primetime Emmy Awards.

Art Carneyâs Film Career

Carney also had a successful film career. His most notable role was in the film âHarry and Tontoâ, for which he won the Academy Award for Best Actor. His other notable films include âThe Late Showâ, âGoing in Styleâ, and âLast Action Heroâ.

Art Carneyâs Net Worth

At the time of his death in 2003, Art Carneyâs net worth was estimated to be around $15 million. This wealth was accumulated through his successful career in television and film.

Art Carneyâs Net Worth in 2024

Art Carney was a remarkable actor and comedian whose work continues to be celebrated. His successful career in television and film earned him substantial wealth.
